    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addAssociatedPart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      when add associated product button is clicked check if selected associated part is instance of InHouse if so check if selectedPart is null if so alert user that nothing is selected if selected part is already in associatedParts list alert that user cant add that part because it already exists in associated parts table else add associated part and update associated parts table repeat the same logic but for instanceof OutSourced
      void editProduct​(Product product)
      sets every field so that when edit product button is pressed every field is set including associatedPartsTable
      Product getNewProduct()
      returns new Product constructor that's initialized

      uses initialize to initialize partsTable, associatedPartsTable and our idField
      java.lang.String modifiedProductIsValid​(Product product)
      validation method that returns errorMessage to be used with alerts
      java.lang.String productIsValid​(Product product)
      validation method that returns errorMessage to be used with alerts
      void removeAssociatedPart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      when remove associated product button is clicked check if selected associated part is instance of InHouse if so check if selectedPart is null if so alert user that nothing is selected else confirm if user wants to actually remove associated part if ok pressed then remove associated part repeat the same logic but for instanceof OutSourced
      Product saveEditedProduct​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      when save product is clicked try loading a new Product if errorMessage.length == 0 when its validated then close dialog pane then set associated parts get every other input update product with Inventory update product method
      Product saveProduct​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      when save product is clicked try loading a new Product if errorMessage.length == 0 when its validated then close dialog pane then set associated parts get every other input add product with Inventory add product method
      void searchForPart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      onAction search for part if integer check if null if null when id is looked up then show alert else if partsField is empty then reset partsTable by setting it to all parts list again else part is found and set table to show found id else is a string if string is empty when searched than there is no match else if partsField is empty then reset partsTable by setting it to all parts list again else else part is found and set table to show found partsList
      void updateProduct​(Product product)
      gets every field and sets the product values accordingly

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        uses initialize to initialize partsTable, associatedPartsTable and our idField
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        location - the location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known
        resources - the resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized

      • searchForPart

        public void searchForPart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        onAction search for part if integer check if null if null when id is looked up then show alert else if partsField is empty then reset partsTable by setting it to all parts list again else part is found and set table to show found id else is a string if string is empty when searched than there is no match else if partsField is empty then reset partsTable by setting it to all parts list again else else part is found and set table to show found partsList
        Parameters:
        event - the ActionEvent that needs to happen to search for part

      • saveProduct

        public Product saveProduct​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                    throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                           java.lang.NullPointerException
        when save product is clicked try loading a new Product if errorMessage.length == 0 when its validated then close dialog pane then set associated parts get every other input add product with Inventory add product method
        Parameters:
        event - the ActionEvent that needs to happen to save a product
        Returns:
        the saveProduct Product instance else alert the user with errorMessages and return null
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - catches whenever numerical input is a non-numerical value
        java.lang.NullPointerException - catches whenever input is null set errorMessage to empty after every catch and fail so that we can actually add our product after not saving successfully if this is not implemented then if product doesn't validate once then we will be in a endless loop of trying to save but not being able to

      • saveEditedProduct

        public Product saveEditedProduct​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                          throws java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                                 java.lang.NullPointerException
        when save product is clicked try loading a new Product if errorMessage.length == 0 when its validated then close dialog pane then set associated parts get every other input update product with Inventory update product method
        Parameters:
        event - the ActionEvent that needs to happen to save an edited product
        Returns:
        the saveProduct Product instance else alert the user with errorMessages and return a new Product instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - catches whenever numerical input is a non-numerical value and return null
        java.lang.NullPointerException - catches whenever input is null and return oldProduct object to fix the program from not allowing the product to save with new values when clicking cancel set errorMessage to empty after every catch and fail so that we can actually update our product after not saving successfully if this is not implemented then if product doesn't validate once then we will be in a endless loop of trying to save but not being able to

      • removeAssociatedPart

        public void removeAssociatedPart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        when remove associated product button is clicked check if selected associated part is instance of InHouse if so check if selectedPart is null if so alert user that nothing is selected else confirm if user wants to actually remove associated part if ok pressed then remove associated part repeat the same logic but for instanceof OutSourced
        Parameters:
        event - the ActionEvent that needs to happen to remove associatedParts

        public void addAssociatedPart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)

        Parameters:
        event - the ActionEvent that needs to happen to add associatedParts
